title: Matter & Atoms Assessment Exam
description: Comprehensive assessment of matter, atoms, and chemical concepts

questions.question: Which particle has the smallest mass?
questions.explanation: Electrons have approximately 1/2000 the mass of protons and neutrons, making them by far the lightest subatomic particle.

questions.question: In a neutral atom, the number of protons equals the number of electrons.
questions.explanation: A neutral atom has no net charge, which requires equal numbers of positive protons and negative electrons.

questions.question: Sodium has an atomic number of 11 and a mass number of 23. How many neutrons does it have?
questions.explanation: Neutrons = mass number - atomic number = 23 - 11 = 12 neutrons.

questions.question: The state of matter with no definite shape or volume is called a _______.
questions.explanation: Gases have particles that are far apart and move freely, so they take the shape and volume of their container.

questions.question: Which of the following is a mixture, not a pure substance?
questions.explanation: Air is a mixture of gases (nitrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide, etc.). The others are pure substances—NaCl and H₂O are compounds, Fe is an element.

questions.question: Metals are found on the right side of the periodic table.
questions.explanation: Metals are found on the left side and center of the periodic table. Nonmetals are on the right side.

questions.question: How many hydrogen atoms are in one molecule of ammonia (NH₃)?
questions.explanation: The subscript 3 in NH₃ indicates there are 3 hydrogen atoms bonded to 1 nitrogen atom.

questions.question: An object has a volume of 25 cm³ and a density of 3 g/cm³. What is its mass?
questions.explanation: Mass = density × volume = 3 g/cm³ × 25 cm³ = 75 g.
